title: Ticket #3294: Keep problem characters out of Bosco sandbox ids
description:
When creating a sandbox on the remote machine for bosco, we need a unique id. We combine the COLLECTOR_HOST and the job's GlobalJobId for this. The ft-gahp creates a directory named after this id and that directory's name is given to the blahp and the batch system behind it. Certain characters that can appear in COLLECTOR_HOST will cause problems in these systems when they are part of a file path. The problem characters include question mark, colon, space, and comma. We need to ensure that the sandbox id is scrubbed of these characters.

To keep the sandbox id from becoming too long, we omit shared-port information in the collector name and only include the name of the first collector. We should still have sufficient uniqueness without these pieces of information.
